round_best: Develop an algorithm for causal discovery that infers the existence and causal relations of latent variables through a combination of variational autoencoders (VAEs) and reinforcement learning. The VAEs can generate a detailed representation of latent structures, while reinforcement learning agents iteratively adjust this representation to optimize a reward function based on agreement with known partial causal relations and predictive accuracy on unseen data. This hybrid approach would allow the model to explore and refine hypotheses about latent variables and their causal connections without relying on the assumption of pure children.
